If it was possible to give this company 0 starts I would. I had been a long standing customer of Corgi Homeplan for several years but after they refused to settle a claim saying a radiator was incorrectly installed (it was installed 8 years prior to us moving into the property). After speaking to the plumber (who was sent) and ended up mending it privately for us - he said the engineers (like him) don't get paid anything by Corgi for the callout fee which means their "callout fee" is essentially admin cost and they always have to battle with them for any kind of money... I questioned why I even bothered having insurance first place. After battling with the pointless complaints process I just gave up and I'd avoid as they never actually covered anything in the years we had them (we'd used them multiple times for small boiler faults and other heating related issues but never anything beyond 1/2 hours work) it just became apparent it was a waste of money.

After being a loyal customer for over twelve years with two properties covered by Corgi, I felt seriously let down. My boiler failed. After four engineer visits I was advised my boiler was beyond economical repair. I admit the boiler was over ten years old. Although it had been covered since brand new by Corgi. However I was informed parts are still readily available via the manufacturer. I firmly believe I was cast aside because this was a big ticket repair, but still repairable. That information came direct from a boiler technician sent via Corgi from the boiler manufacturer. I was also informed that Corgi will send in the cheapest engineer they can contact in your area. This may result in a less qualified engineer attending your property who may not have the necessary skills to correctly diagnose faults with your boiler. Please note, I can‚Äôt verify this claim. But this is my own experience after they sent a fully qualified boiler technician from the manufacturer after Corgi‚Äôs own boiler engineers 4th visit without correctly diagnosing the fault. I have now had a new boiler fitted by a fully qualified ex manufacturer employee who runs his own business. More than happy with the quality of work and cost to supply and fit. The cost quoted by Corgi to supply and fit my new boiler was more expensive than what I have just paid. That quote also included a supposedly ¬£400 discount added. Corgi have now lost my loyalty and business and I will never use them again.

I took out the Complete cover level with Corgi, thinking that whatever went wrong would be covered, including the boiler and central heating system, and all internal plumbing, including waste pipes. I also carefully read the "exclusions"  shown on the web page describing the details of Complete cover.However, when I had a waste pipe problem, Corgi told me that they would repair the pipe once I had removed the bath and taken up the floor boards.  Despite the list of "exclusions" on the sales webpage, on page 15 of their 28 page Terms and Conditions book is a section which reads; "Access and Making Good Any costs for materials and labour needed: ‚Ä¢ to gain access to your boiler or central heating system, ‚Ä¢ to gain access to pipes or wiring within walls, ceilings or underfloor and ‚Ä¢ for redecoration, restoration of walls, ceilings fixtures and fittings or replacement of floor coverings, once we finish."In other words, Corgi cover for internal plumbing and pipes only applies to already exposed pipes.  In any modern house, of course,  99% of the pipework is covered; thus your plumbing and pipework is , in effect, not covered by the Corgi plan.Needless to say I will not be renewing my cover with Corgi.

Please make sure you read ALL 28 pages of their Terms and Conditions. Eight years at circa ¬£40 a month which is over ¬£3,000 paid :(

Came home from a short break to find a wet patch on kitchen ceiling,checked upstairs and found leaky rad valve, water dribbling down the copper to the ceiling below. I checked my Corgi policy and rang asap, Margret said they would send an engineer soonest, he would give me a call. Minutes later, Simon rang, asked for detail and said he would be with us before lunch, wow, Saturday, thought we would have to wait till Monday. Simon drained the system a bit, swapped out the valve in 30mins, but on refilling, there was some kind of air lock, so boiler didn't fire up. After a couple of goes, success, back in action. An hour later, we noticed a radiator not heating up, so rang Corgi again, James advised me to close off all the other rads and see if that forced the water through the cold one, bingo, I called Corgi back to let them know it was a success, and wouldn't need the engineer back. Andrew, updated their system and said he'd let the others know too. Super helpful all round. Never used the corgi service before, I'm so glad they were there.

I always decline automatic renewal for services. I received an email about my boiler cover coming up for renewal. The email stated that unless I called up and renewed the service it would terminate. As I wanted to go to a cheaper provider [UW], I did nothing and started a new boiler cover with the other company. I then saw that corgi charged me anyway. When I called up, the Customer Service guy accepted that they made a mistake and apparently they sent out a follow up email that my service will renew automatically. This email I have never read as I was comfortable in the knowledge that my service was going to terminate at the end of its term. They not only issued no refund for their mistake, but they also charged me a termination fee. Their mistake cost me close to ¬£80. I expected better problem resolution from a company that rates so highly on TrustPilot. I've been a customer over a decade and have recommended them in the past. After this incident, I will no longer recommend them. What a pity.

Absolutely terrible. An old radiator fell down, after wear and tear, a towel rad. It fell and damaged the pipe work, causing a leak. I called Corgiplan and was told the earliest an engineer could come was 24 hours from then. In the meantime, they did not advise how to stop the water flooding my bathroom, so I took it upon myself to google it, and it said cut the water, switch the boiler off. So we had no hot water or heating for 24 hours; I told them this, they said they were 'busy'. No advice whatsoever. I even told them I have a vulnerable person in the house, which they didn't really care about. 24 hours later, an engineer turned up, didn't touch anything, said he couldn't do it, as the radiator fell, and it was 'installer error'. I explained that the radiator,  bathroom, and extension was over 20 years old, and do they not allow for wear and tear. They said they do, but they said the engineer said it was installer error, which they do not cover. He then left, leaving us with no hot water or heating, for another 24 hours with a vulnerable person. Support staff on the phone called me to explain that they do not cover installer error, I argued that this is a 20 year old bathroom so how could it be installer error after 20 years! He finally listened and agreed to send another engineer. The engineer came (more than 2.5 days without hot water or heating, with a vulnerable person in the house). He said, oh that's fine, and proceeded to repair the problem within a couple of hours! WHAT A DISGRACE ON CORGI HOME PLANS PART TO HAVE NO EMPATHY AND IN FACT, ACCUSE THE CUSTOMER TO TRY AND GET OUT OF REPAIRING A GENIUNE ISSUE. YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF YOURSELVES IN THE WAY YOU HAVE CONDUCTED YOUR BUSINESS WITH REGARDS TO THIS CASE, AND YOU SHOULD ALSO REPRIMAND THE FIRST ENGINEER WHO DID NOTHING AND WAS HAPPY TO LEAVE A HOUSE, WITH A VUNERABLE PERSON WITHOUT HOTWATER OR HEATING FOR 2.5 DAYS.

In November 2023 I joined OVO who had a promotional offer with their sister company Corgi. The offer was six months free boiler cover. However, after shopping around a bit more, I decided to change my supplier during the 14 day COOLING OFF PERIOD. No payment or contract was ever set up with OVO or Corgi as I was entitled to cancel and I thought that was that.Well, March 2024 ¬£15 had been taken from my account from Corgi. When I queried this with OVO they explained that it was Corgi I needed to speak to as they were the ones who had taken payment. This didn‚Äôt make any sense to me as I had never given Corgi my direct debit details. However, as I had made the contract with OVO (and cancelled within the 14 day cooling off period) I realised it must have been passed on to them.OVO stated I needed to contact Corgi which I duly did.  They explained that when making the contract with OVO and cancelling during the 14 day cooling off period, I had to also contact them. How does that even make any sense?? When I told Corgi I had never been with OVO and they had no right to pass my direct debit details onto them as I had cancelled within the legal time limit of 14 days, they completely neglected this and stated if I wanted to get out of contract I would have to pay an additional ¬£55. They have now made ¬£70 off me for doing nothing. ¬£70 in a cost of living crisis and ¬£70 because I apparently had to call them directly to state I was no longer with OVO and therefore did not want boiler cover.It is one big promotional scam.Corgi is meant to be a trusted company. Their joining with OVO is far from that. I have never given them permission to take money from my account. Never. Yet OVO passed on my details in that cooling off period and did not advise that you have to call them separately as in this case they now act as a separate entity- as it suits them!!I will be contacting the ombudsman because I am appalled at this act of actual daylight robbery.

3 years ago Corgi homeplan replaced my boiler and installed a new thermostat linked to Tado. I didn't ask for this but was told I may as well have it as time goes on meaning I could adjust it from my phone. Fast forward to now and my heating wouldn't work. The policy states external thermostats are covered, but several paragraphs and points later there is a badly worded exclusion which means online thermostats are not covered (although it doesn't say thermostat). According to the complaints department it's my fault as it's my responsibility to check all the wording. So this is a warning to anyone with a nest, hive, tado or other control, you will not be covered for thermostat issues. Also be aware the policy is not clear and will contain get out clauses for what I would consider to be a standard central heating part.

Being a pensioner I try to plan for any financial issues so have always had a boiler service plan.  My annual service happened on 26th of last month, when the engineer found what he called a tiny pinpoint  hole on something to do with the extraction pipes.Boiler turned off and he reported this back.  Because of the bank holiday what I thought was the repair visit took place on Friday 5th.  This chap told me he was there to decide if the boiler was worth repairing.  He said it wasn't.  So I have another weekend with no heat or hot water and no idea if I have to fork out for a new boiler, which the last man said was possible.  Surely such policies are there to help speed things up?Please read all small print carefully.  I've just had to pay an excess for someone condemning a boiler which is not producing any carbon monoxide.

The corgi response team are polite, but that is where the good part ends. Anything they do is dependent on who they book. Until 2 years ago I would happily have awarded Corgi 5 stars but, since being taken over by Ovo it has gone completely to ‚Äúpot‚Äù, if I could award no stars I would, but Trustpilot don‚Äôt allow that.We (two elderly pensioners) have been left for over a week without heating and hot water in one of the coldest periods of weather this winter.Previously I would have received a call from the allocated engineer very shortly after reporting the fault to ascertain the problem and been given an approximate time of arrival.When finding the fault the necessary components would be sourced locally and the problem fixed on  that or the following day ‚Äì 5 stars.Having reported the fault at 8:45 am and waited in all day I had to call Corgi in the late afternoon to give me an approximate time of arrival of the engineer. Subsequently I had to chase Corgi several times for any information and that has been the case for the whole period until repair is completed.The important information I have gleaned is that engineers can source parts only from a Corgi approved supplier which cannot supply parts immediately, in this case no less than 5 days, yet, my little market town has 4 plumber‚Äôs merchants all with any necessary parts immediately to hand.Following this most recent experience my advice ‚Äì don‚Äôt go anywhere near Corgi.(Former Corgi Acc No 851742)

I am thoroughly disappointed with the service from Corgi Homeplan having difficulty getting through on the phone and immediately being diverted to the internet instead to log a call for an engineer - not a service when your boiler breaks in winter.  I had trouble with my boiler December - February and latterly could not get through to them at all when I called out a local man who came promptly next morning and did a thorough job to get my boiler working properly.  The man who came to fix my boiler from OVO in December said if it goes again I'd need a new control panel.  The boiler worked for about 2 weeks and then started causing problems limping along to February.I put in a complaint to OVO which was ignored for a month and they continued to take my direct debit payment in March despite me telling them not to take more money from my bank until the complaint was dealt with.   They have ignored the fact that my boiler was not working properly throughout, told me that there was nothing wrong with their phones and said their boiler cover does not cover a full strip down of the boiler (not really a good service if your boiler breaks down if they only cover the bare minimum).  So I cancelled my contract for which they charged me a cancellation fee when they left my boiler in an unfit state.So my advice is to use your local heating engineer - someone who is going to do a thorough job to ensure your boiler works properly and safely.

I have their " Complete " level plumbing and boiler insurance . I phoned in to report a leak from my shower tray causing damp on the skirting boardand another leak in the downstairs cloakroom . I had to pay the ¬£60 excess on my claim ahead of anyone doing anything . I sent thier plumber pictures of the issue that evening . The following day , their plumber turns up , a bit late after chasing him on the phone . He identifies the issues , leaking shower mastic , so new beading needs to be done and there is a leak from the waste hose on my dishwasher which is causing the damp in the cloakroom . All fine , he says I need to call Corgi , I make myself a coffee and sit in my lounge . I'm wondering why he's taking so long and see his van has gone , no idea what he's doing , but I have a missed call and voicemail from Corgi . None of this work apparently falls under the cover of their " Complete" Insurance , they never cover anything shower related , and the waste hose is apparently a machine fault and so we aren't going to do anything about it . " It's in our T's and C's " . This is true , the 27 page booklet of small print does specify they don't cover shower cubicles , trays etc.. but this is at odds with the covering letter sent proclaiming everything is insured . I feel it's a con , they took the excess whilst nowing they wouldn't cover at least part of the work required and never mentioned this on the initial phone call .I have previously had a good experience with them , when they did replace my original shower unit ( with a much cheaper model but it's still a shower ! ) . The plumber just left me , no " Good bye  , or there's a problem with your cover , he just left , with my dishwasher in the middle of the kitchen and the cloakroom light on and fan running , just so very rude and unprofessional . I will not be renewing my cover with them .

Corgi are a shambles. Last year they sent two plumbers over 3 visits to fix the toilet leaking but said it was not fixable. Eventually I got the replacement part from Amazon for ¬£26 and then watched a you tube video. After 15 minutes I had fixed it. It took months of arguing with Corgi to get the excess they charged me refunded. Unfortunately for me they auto renewed my policy so I ended up stuck with them for a further 12 months. During the routine boiler service they discovered a defective seal and advised not to use until seal replaced. Said they will get part and send engineer in few days. A new engineer from the manufacture called and said they will be with us on Saturday two days later. I cancelled my weekend away and when he arrived he wanted to know what‚Äôs wrong with exclaiming we never carry parts so I said why have you come then. He said he will order parts and come next week. He left and then returned to say he has decided to cut the gas pipe to boiler which was not unsafe but he didn‚Äôt want me to try using it despite already not turning in on for last two days. I asked him to leave and come back when he has parts. The next thing is he called gas board and they came threatening to force entry to property. I had my annual boiler service this week. I told the engineer that I had to top up the pressure of the boiler once in a while. The engineer checked the boiler and told me that there was a leak that was causing it. He said I'd need to pay 60 pounds to get it replaced. I paid.2 ours after he left the pressure was gone, now I have to top it up twice a day. I called them and they sent another engineer who said that the problem was everywhere and that it was due to the limescale build up, not a specific part and that the previous engineer should have told me that.Corgi doesn't cover limescale build up so I called to ask for refund of the 60 pounds that I was charged for no reason. They refused. This is clearly one of those cases of a company taking advantage of the lack of knowledge of their clients.Avoid at all costs.

Our boiler service was almodt due and an engineer called us to arrange a visit. He explained he was doing another job as well as services for Corgi but could fit us in after 6pm during his holiday. Sept 4th was the date. It was the last day of our holiday so we rushed back to make sure we were available. He duly arrived on the drive but said he couldn't do the work and showed us an email from Corgi saying his public liability insurance had expired. He said Corgi would be in touch to re- arrange. On Monday 9th Sept we woke up to no hot water and no heating. My husband contacted Corgi Homeplan and requested urgent assistance. We had a call at 7pm that evening but we were not available so he said he would call Tues before 10am. By noon we had heard nothing. We chased and said it was urgent etc.... finally an engineer came after 6pm and said parts were required from Worcester Bosch and they would call that evening or Wed 1st thing to organise to provide the parts and do the work within 48hrs. No call from Worcester Bosch.  10.19am Wed they called and said it would be another 2 days.I chased Corgi again around 11.30am and said I wanted to raise a complaint and speak to a manager. I was on hold  for 30 minutes. I was told I could only get a manager on call back they couldn't put me through. Third day with no hot water- my husband is in his 70s and had a procedure under sedation at hospital at 2.30pm Wed afternoon so he had to have a cold shower. By 4.25pm no manager had called. I rang again. Another 30minutes until phone answered. I was told the wrong manager had been requested to call but had been looking into our issue - for 6hours!!! The customer service for Corgi is appalling  the last call resulted in me being told the parts people and customer relations aren't available after 5pm which is really helpful after customers sit on hold for 30mins every time they contact you. We have been told someone should get back to us tomorrow. We are sitting in a cold house with no hot water. My advice is DO NOT TOUCH CORGI HOMEPLAN. I have made it abundantly clear this is NOT acceptable and their management are to blame. I want my policy payments refunded at the very least and I'm tempted to book into a hotel and send Corgi the bill. I am furious. They do not deserve the business and have no respect for customers who have been with them for many years.

I have Corgi for boiler and heating system cover. I recently had my first problem. This is when you really find out how good or bad a company is that you are 'associated with'. I was extremely reassured when I received a call from their CS department informing me of what they had been looking into and what they were going to do to resolve 'the problem' fully. Our annual boiler service was arranged by Corgi, and we took the offered day/time. The engineer called as booked. When he pulled down the control panel of the boiler, water immediately began shooting across the room. It quickly became clear that the person who carried out the annual service last year had pinched a small pipe when he closed up.The engineer managed to greatly reduce the flow of water and within 24 hours a second engineer had arrived to replace the damaged part and carry out the service. All credit to Ignis Boiler Services.My reason for only giving Corgi HomePlan 3 stars this time is that I had to pay a ¬£60 excess to have the damage repaired. According to the pleasant lady who called from Corgi to claim the excess, it was a shame that the damage hadn't been spotted within 12 months - suggesting that it would then have been rectified without paying the excess.I really don't see how that can work; Corgi offer the service date and I was not offered one within 12 months of the previous service. Also, if the damage is inside the boiler, who is going to take their boiler apart to check the work that the qualified engineer has done?I've been happy to pay an excess in the past when a repair has been needed, but I'm annoyed that I had to pay to repair a mistake made by one of their sub-contractors.

Started off with we had to find the water leak in our house. Which we did and then promptly you sent an engineer who didn't get his tools in to be told we need more access. Then though we discussed with him how the job could be completed via another room. When I called I logged a complaint as it was clear the engineer did not want to do the work. He was approx 30th engineer you contacted. By this point we had been without water for 3 days. But it wasn't an "emergency " as the water was off. Finally after asking what the budget was and we would find someone local you sent an engineer on day 4. He was at the house no more than an 1hr30min and the jobs was done as discussed with your 1st engineer. This guy was practical and considerate and he didn't waste time in getting it sorted. On day 4 of all of this our downstairs sockets tripped and would not reset. We thought that water from the leak might be involved, the engineer came and identified the fault on day 5 (nothing to do with the water) made a temporary fix by removing the room that was tripping it. He wrote a quote to corgi to get the work completed. I called corgi to check it was in the policy and on day 7 the new ring main was installed. However 2weeks later, I am still waiting a call from customer relations regarding the 9 phone calls to get the 2nd plumber out and why is it not an emergency.  As well as the electrical certificate for the new ring main. All staff were polite and helpful but it did feel like walking through treacle with the call out team when it was clear finding an engineer was not going to be easy, call backs were slow

My experience has been nothing short of a disaster.My heating system started cutting out for no apparent reason.  The engineer came and blamed my solar system saying it had caused a valve to fail and on second visit fitted a very cheap new valve.  This valve lasted but 24 hours before it failed.  Today Worcester Bosch came to see if I had a boiler failure of some kind as there was no power showing on the boiler.  This engineer said the failure was in the airing cupboard.  He identified the new valve of very poor quality had failed.  Another local plumber attended.. replaced the troublesome valve and got the heating going again.  All of this nonsense took over a week to resolve and in the end I simply paid for a good quality valve and the time of a very competent local plumber.  I am left wondering what was the point of taking out the Corgi HomePlan when the quality of the product they use for their repairs is so low.Never again.

We have been relying on Corgi for at least 7 years to keep us safe. We have the corgi home plan policy which should cover us for boiler, water, pipes etcToday our yearly boiler check was carried out and the engineer asked where the over flow pipe was as he couldn‚Äôt find one. In the end he found it but it had been cemented inside the wall and this is very dangerous because as he explained it‚Äôs like a kettle that needs to overflow an outlet or it‚Äôll explode if it cannot. We have been lucky that up to now the boiler didn‚Äôt need to over flow or we would have had a massive accident I explained to the engineer that over the years with Corgi we have had dozens of boiler checks and not one of the engineers has ever picked this up. He said it‚Äôs a very basic check that should have been done and spotted - that the over flow pipe was blocked (had no outlet) So we‚Äôve been paying Corgi each month for years and years and they didn‚Äôt even do the basic checks to keep us safeWe are shocked and disappointed Corgi

SUMMER 2024The ‚Äúengineer‚Äù (overused job title, it should at best be technician) didn‚Äôt do essential things but did do unnecessary things. I‚Äôve previously had my boiler serviced by Vaillant, I also have a background in engineering, so I have a good understanding of what needs to be done.With the exception of the flue gases check, the OVO/CORGI service was a complete waste of time and if it wasn‚Äôt already included within my ‚Äúplan‚Äù I would not have paid for it.The ‚Äúengineer‚Äù who visited did virtually nothing. After a visual check, the only technical thing he did was to check the flue readings.He did not remove the cover to the combustion chamber and so did not clean and vacuum the surface of the heat exchanger and so did not fit a new graphite gasket (I believe the Vaillant recommended service interval is 2 years). I asked if he was going to change the gasket, he called head office and they said no!He did not clean the siphon/trap which tends to fill up with the debris from the heat exchanger.He did, however, waste his time cleaning the Magnaclean filter ‚Äì this is external to the boiler, a waste of time as I do it myself every couple of months!So, on a Saturday morning a couple of weeks ago, my boiler stopped working due to the siphon being blocked with the debris from the combustion chamber! For simplicity, I unblocked it myself rather than make a call and have to wait.The level of service undertaken was, to my mind, ineffective and will, ultimately, result in a problem and/or a failure and the need for a call out. I have arranged for a local plumber to visit and undertake a thorough clean of all pipework, the heat exchanger (inc. gasket) and the siphon.A MORAL? If you are going to undertake a boiler service then I suggest you undertake the service to the same, or preferably a higher standard to the manufacturer, not the absolute bare minimum requirement. This is lulling most people into a false sense of security and they‚Äôre not getting what they think they‚Äôre paying for. To my mind, do it properly, or even go over and above, or not at all.
